alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 10:44PM EDT until March 25 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tallahassee FL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Florida... Chipola River near Altha (CR 274) affecting Calhoun County. For the Chipola River...including Altha (CR 274)...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Chipola River near Altha (CR 274). * WHEN...From Wednesday evening to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Water will start to affect houses and mobile homes in the flood plain downstream from the gage. A few fish camps downstream of highway 20 will be affected by flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Wednesday evening to a crest of 22.6 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.6 feet on 10/03/1994. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
